Job Title: Trainee (3 months), (Partnership) U Professionals, Managers and Executives (U PME)
Job Description:
Background:

U PME is a community to support Professionals, Managers and Executives (PMEs) with a common interest in workplace, career and professional development.

In this rapidly evolving work environment, PMEs face tremendous employment challenges and are constantly looking out for opportunities. U PME aims to empower you to chart your career path, educate you on work-related matters and connect you to our strong network of partners.

Job Description:

1) Enhance NTUC’s PMEs ecosystem

To build, cultivate and nurture working relationships with assigned stakeholders
To outreach to existing and potential stakeholders to upsell LM programmes and union membership.
To jointly plan, develop, execute events and initiatives with associations to help the PMEs stay relevant and employable within and across sectors. To support such events and initiatives with membership recruitment opportunities, marketing outreach, and communications as required.
Develop and track data collected through opinion polls, questionnaires, and surveys.
Gather regular feedback from the ground, synthesize information, and develop partnership programmes to align associations’ and Labour Movement’s goals.
Track programs, budgeting and monitor attainment of objectives.
Keep abreast of industry updates, government policies and macro-economic trends
Processing of membership application and ensuring that all necessary information is provided.

2) Align: Mutual Value Creation

To bridge relationships between assigned associations and other LM limbs, in particular relevant unions
To identify opportunities for Union-UA alliances, and propose and execute activation programmes and initiatives under the alliance.
To identify and nurture associations with potential to be affiliated to NTUC or the unions.
To create value for PMEs to join LM’s ecosystem.

Requirements:

Degree Holders in any disciplines
Open to fresh university graduates in 2023/2024
Strong analytical skills and experience in data analysis and market share analysis
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work well under pressure.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.

Trainees will be considered for a conversion to permanent role at the end of 3 month trial.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Responsibilities
Ensure maximum uptime for multiple production systems
Provide L1/L2 application production support to users for trading, data processing, and IT operations
Provide weekend support in a rotational basis and occasional public holiday support Manage, own and frequently follow-up incidents and requests raised to the team.
Monitor and follow up critical system alerts; perform initial diagnosis and potential fix and escalate to the right teams.
Assume the role of major incident manager upon major incidents, focusing on coordinating efforts, seeking updates from fellow tech teammates and providing timely updates to all stakeholders.
Perform system operation and administration tasks, including checking and monitor multiple systems performance on a daily basis
Work closely with internal users and external vendors to investigate and resolve production system issues, and communicate system enhancement /bug fix requirements to multiple engineering teams
Help the team manager to refine and streamline day to day operations via automations
Help the team manager to define work rosters, schedules and other managerial tasks.
Help the team manager to formulate and continuously improve the team’s way of working.
Work to comply with SLA and OLA
Hands-on for incident management, change management and response management and writing RCA reports.
Document knowledge articles and manage the team's knowledge base; share and promote overall knowledge level
Provide support in non-office hours during emergency situations.
Coordinate between product and development teams to ensure effective delivery of supporting services to the end-user
Stay abreast of the latest technology and trends
Requirements
Impeccable sense of self-discipline, responsibility and integrity.
A strong interest in working in crypto technology and financial environments.
1 year of experience in application support or application development.
Proficient in spoken and written English language; Chinese language is helpful but not a must.
Very strong team player and ability to proactively manage self and team's work with little supervision; high sense of responsibility and integrity.
Experience in Database queries / SQLs
Knowledge in shell scripting and basic linux commands.
Excellent problem solving skill with a keen eye for detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Excellent time management ability and self organised and motivated.

Job Title: Telesales cum Digital Marketing Executive - Up to SGD78K Annually (Full Time/Part Time)
Job Description:
Join Our Team and Shape the Future of the Medical-Aesthetics Industry!

ClearSK Healthcare, a renowned chain of medical aesthetic clinics operating in Singapore, Shanghai, Hangzhou, and Kuala Lumpur, is on the hunt for a driven and seasoned Digital Marketing Executive to become part of our dynamic team.

As a Telesales cum Digital Marketing Executive at ClearSK, you will play a crucial role in our success by converting customer inquiries into appointments and online sales through phone calls, Whatsapp &/or SMS conversations. You will also be responsible for driving our digital marketing efforts across various platforms, including but not limited to Google, Facebook, Instagram, Xiao Hong Shu, and WeChat, to engage potential customers, turning inquiries into appointments or sales. You will be cross-trained to operate or track marketing campaigns or perform operational audit.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

Telesales Responsibilities:

Convert customer inquiries into appointments and online sales, showcasing your exceptional sales acumen.
Efficiently negotiate and book appointments based on customer preferences into our efficient online booking system.
Handle inbound and outbound calls, providing exemplary customer service, and ensuring customer satisfaction. You will also be responsible for placating unhappy customers, and when necessary, escalating cases to the service manager or management for follow-up.
Avail yourself of training provided to effectively use standard phone scripts, filter calling leads from our customer database, and manage the computerized call/text systems securely.
Reach out to absentee customers and persuade them to return for visits or treatment appointments, showcasing your persuasive skills.
Optimize booking schedules by rescheduling customers' appointments from no-show slots and reallocating overbooked slots/doctors to under-booked ones.
Learn to enter sales invoices and manage package utilization/deductions on a timely basis while ensuring the completeness of the sales contract.

Digital Marketing Responsibilities:

Develop, manage, and optimize ads and social media content across various platforms in different languages, including Google, Facebook, Instagram, Xiao Hong Shu, and WeChat, showcasing your digital marketing expertise.
Leverage your excellent communication skills to engage potential customers and effectively convert inquiries into appointments or sales.
Drive the implementation of omnichannel marketing strategies, enhancing customer interaction and service, thereby contributing to our clinic's growth and success.
Stay updated with the latest marketing technologies, continuously learning and integrating new advancements, such as ChatGPT, into our marketing strategies.
Work closely with our in-house marketing and sales team to drive sales events, in-house marketing campaigns, and customer reviews, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
Provide invaluable assistance in planning, organizing, and executing online sales events, contributing to the clinic's achievements.

What We're Looking For:

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, E commerce, Business or any related field. Applications from recent graduates are highly encouraged.
At least 3 years of experience in digital marketing, ideally in the healthcare or aesthetics industry.
Exceptional communication skills and fluent in both Eng and Chin, able to cater to English-speaking & PRC customers.
A tech-savvy individual with a solid understanding of digital marketing tools and platforms.
Creative thinking combined with a data-driven approach to marketing.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail.
Experience with omnichannel marketing.
A willingness to learn and incorporate new technologies.
Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple priorities effectively.

What We Offer:

An attractive remuneration package with performance-based incentives.
Comprehensive training and ongoing support to excel in your role.
Opportunities for career advancement within our growing organization.
A friendly and inclusive work culture that values teamwork and collaboration.
The chance to make a real difference in people's lives by helping them achieve their aesthetic goals.
Access to state-of-the-art aesthetic treatments and services at discounted rates.

Join us at ClearSK Healthcare, and let's embark on an exciting journey together, empowering beauty and transforming lives! If you are ready to take on this rewarding challenge, we want to hear from you. Apply now and be a part of our passionate team committed to making a lasting impact on the world of aesthetics.

Job Description:
Young NTUC is the youth wing of the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC). Since our founding in April of 2005, Young NTUC has grown to over 150,000 members aged 35 years and below. Young NTUC supports youth throughout their professional and personal journey to achieve their aspirations through a multitude of purposeful activities and opportunities. In collaboration with a vast number of partners ranging from unions to companies to government agencies, we can provide career discovery and navigation, workplace protection and support, leadership development, mental well-being resources, holistic personal development and many more.





RESPONSIBILITIES:

Design and implement engagements and initiatives aimed at increasing awareness and participation in Young NTUC programmes, ultimately boosting membership among youths.
Develop and maintain partnerships with multiple internal and external stakeholders, including coordinating varying modalities of engagement to engage youths.
Ensure alignment and collaboration with the Programmes & Partnerships team and the Membership team.
Manage day-to-day activities and administration of assigned Young NTUC initiatives, including engagement and relationship building, programme co-ordination, providing secretariat support for meetings, reporting, budgeting, as well as tracking and measuring outcomes.
Manage additional duties as assigned, particularly in relation to outreach and engagements.

Requirements:

Degree holder in any discipline
Open to fresh university graduates in 2023/2024
Good engagement and influencing skills.
High energy level and commitment.
Able to work on weekday evenings and weekends.
Good understanding of the dynamics and challenges of youth sector.
Prior experience in membership-related roles will be advantageous.
Understand the career and lifestyle needs of entry level candidates, to develop programmes and value propositions for them.
Comfortable to build a community and run community engagement over digital platforms

This will be a 3-month trial program, candidates will join as trainee in view of conversion to permanent staff at the end of the trial.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

No experience necessary! Full training provided. Freshers and undergrads welcome to apply!

We are looking for university students or fresh graduates in Singapore to join us as a Student Financial Advisor. Are you are looking to kickstart your career, or seeking a meaningful role while studying?

This role offers flexible work arrangement, equipping you with essential knowledge on financial planning, along with attractive remunerations. Fret not, training & mentorship will be provided. Connect with us and explore a fulfilling career in financial advisory.





A day in the life of our Student Financial Advisor:

Financial Strategy Development: Understanding your clients’ financial situations & goals to devise strategies that cater to their needs.
Insurance and Financial Advisory: Provide a holistic approach on insurance and financial planning in areas such as retirement, education, and investments supported by our comprehensive product suite.
Financial Analysis: Prepare and present financial summaries, investment reports, and income projections for clients.
Client Relationship Management: Build strong relationships through regular reviews to adapt clients’ financial plans to life changes.
Client Networking: Establish and grow a strong client base through networking & prospecting.

Singaporeans preferred

Mentorship from Success Stories: Guided by mentors who began their successful careers as students, including one who earned S$90K/month during their days at NUS.
Apply now and kickstart your career in financial advisory!

Job Description:

Are you an experienced customer service professional or a recent graduate with a passion for growth, seeking an opportunity to lead and excel in the education sector? Are you driven by the prospect of managing a team, nurturing client relationships, and supporting a dynamic sales force? If so, United Language Centre (ULC), a renowned language institution and expat community hub in Singapore, invites you to join us as a dedicated Customer Service Supervisor.





As a Customer Service Supervisor at ULC, you will oversee our customer service team and report directly to the Operations / Centre Manager. Your role will be instrumental in ensuring smooth operations, delivering exceptional service to our students and educators, and upholding our commitment to excellence.





Responsibilities:

Supervise and mentor the customer service team, ensuring adherence to service standards and protocols.
Collaborate with teachers and the sales team to optimize customer experiences and achieve sales targets.
Manage student accounts, including credits, packages, and progress tracking.
Represent ULC professionally in all customer interactions, embodying our values and mission.
Coordinate scheduling of private lessons, handling bookings, rescheduling, and instructor assignments.
Facilitate communication among students, parents, educators, and sales team via WhatsApp groups.
Generate monthly reports on credit usage and identify opportunities for renewal and retention.
Implement and maintain efficient workflows and systems to streamline customer service operations.
Address customer inquiries, concerns, and escalations promptly and effectively.
Stay updated on industry trends and customer feedback to drive continuous improvement initiatives.
Undertake such other duties as may be assigned.

Requirements:

Proven experience in a customer service role, preferably within the education or language training sector. Leadership experience is a plus.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect with diverse stakeholders.
Exceptional organizational abilities, capable of managing multiple tasks and priorities effectively.
Self-motivated and dedicated, with a passion for enhancing customer experiences and achieving results.
Collaborative mindset, able to work well within a team and across departments.
Proficiency in English, with additional language skills considered advantageous.
Familiarity with CRM systems, such as HubSpot, is preferred
Ability to work effectively under pressure and meet deadlines.
Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as required.





What we offer:

Competitive salary range of SGD 2900 to SGD 3200, inclusive of incentives and allowances.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional growth within our expanding organization.
Ongoing training and development programs tailored to enhance your leadership and customer service skills.
Supportive and collaborative work environment, promoting teamwork and knowledge sharing.
The chance to make a meaningful impact on students' lives and contribute to their language learning journey.





Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your understanding.

United Language Centre is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and believe that a diverse workforce strengthens our organization. We look forward to receiving your application!

Job Title: Systems Engineer, Cybersecurity Development Programme (CSDP) - July 2024 Intake
Job Description:
Job Summary

Job Type
Permanent

Seniority


Years of Experience
Information not provided


Job Description

CSA’s Cybersecurity Development Programme (CSDP) is a 12-month programme to develop cybersecurity talents in the public sector, with the aim of building up cybersecurity capabilities to secure Singapore’s digital economy and infrastructure.

CSDP is open to both recent graduates and working professionals, and consists of two phases: a rigorous 3-month classroom training phase, followed by a 9-month job posting.

During the 3-month training phase, CSDP officers will acquire cybersecurity certifications* such as:
EC-Council’s Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) (including CEH Masters) conducted by Ngee Ann Polytechnic;
Cisco’s CyberOps Associate conducted by CSA Academy;
Singapore University of Technology and Design’s (SUTD) ModularMaster Certificate in Cybersecurity (four modules)

Thereafter, CSDP officers will take on a 9-month posting in one of CSA’s divisions, with the opportunity** to gain experience in one of these areas in cybersecurity (non-exhaustive):
Malware Analysis
Digital Forensics & Incident Response
Emerging Technologies
Penetration Testing
Cybersecurity Solutions and Consultancy
Cybersecurity Operations Centre
Threat Intelligence
Governance, Risk and Compliance

During the 9-month posting, CSDP officers will also gain valuable experience working on cybersecurity projects at the national level, undergo technical and non-technical courses, and receive exposure to front-facing engagements with recognised industry players, the general public and students.

At the end of the 12-month programme, CSDP officers can look forward to additional development opportunities either in CSA or other government agencies (upon successful deployment at the of programme). CSDP officers will also be awarded the:
CSDP Certificate of Completion
SUTD ModularMaster Certificate in Cybersecurity

Training may be subject to change.

**Further assessment(s) may be required in order to determine the officer’s suitability for the first job posting, factoring in each officer’s interest and the cybersecurity needs across the Whole-Of-Government (WOG). Due consideration will be taken on a case-by-case basis and the final decision on the first job posting will be at CSA’s discretion .

To find out more, visit https://www.csa.gov.sg/faq/cybersecurity-development-programme.

Responsibilities

Execution of project in accordance with general specifications, particular specifications, technical specifications and drawings, etc.
Effective communication between engineering, technical, construction, and project control groups.
Co-ordinate with clients, consultants, subcontractors and suppliers to ensure timely delivery of works.
Co-ordinate with subcontractors, suppliers and own teams for implementation of the projects and ensuring it is being built correctly.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Monitoring and carrying out quality check on progressive completed work.
Develop method of statements and testing procedures for the works.
Inspect installations and observe operations to ensure compliance with design and equipment specifications and safety standards.
Write reports and documentations.

Requirements

Diploma / Degree in Electrical Engineering
3 years of working experiences in electrical installation in industrial plants
Technical skills and knowledge of HT, LT Switchboards, Transformers, Generators, Motor Starters, Testing and Commissioning
Familiar with relevant Singapore standards and international standards.
Positive working attitude and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Meticulous with an eye for detail
Salary will commensurate with experience
Fresh graduates welcome

Job Title: Trainee (3 months), U Small Medium Enterprise (U SME)
Job Description:
Background:

The U Small Medium Enterprise (U SME) is a vital unit within NTUC, dedicated to empowering SMEs in cultivating positive workplaces through progressive HR practices. Our mission is to foster a holistic work environment that promotes excellence in the workplace, work processes, and the workforce, ensuring an enhanced work experience for all employees. Working closely with the wider NTUC Family of social enterprises and unions, U SME actively seeks and engage progressive Singapore SMEs and their C-Suite level executives to provide resources and know-how to achieve mutual growth for both SMEs and employees.

The U SME is expanding and is looking for industry sector account managers who have a passion for championing workers’ wages, welfare and work prospects.

Job Description:

Proactively explore untapped industry sectors and establish connections with new SME companies to broaden our Labour Movement Partners network and expand our NTUC membership base.
Responsible for the account management of SME accounts. Our accounts are across industries, and the candidate will be assigned to an industry where they can excel and thrive, enabling them to achieve the set targets successfully. Experience working in these industries or having a passion for these industries will have an added advantage.
Collaborate as a cohesive team to ideate, create, and implement innovative programs and campaigns targeted towards SMEs and SME workers, with the aim of broadening the NTUC membership base and enriching the partnership and membership experience for Labour Movement Partners and our members.
Advocate workplace best practices by forging partnerships through signed MOUs, facilitating the transformation of SME companies into progressive and employee-friendly employers.
Gain an in-depth understanding of the challenges and concerns faced by SME workers and employers in the industry, enabling the development of effective programs and campaigns aligned with the unit’s objectives.
Create awareness of U SME’s efforts, programs and campaigns through social media content.
Represent U SME and the Labour Movement in cross-department and tripartite platforms to further the interests of SME workers.

Requirements:

Good Degree in any discipline
Open to fresh university graduates in 2023/2024
Passion to represent and protect workers’ interests
Thinking-out-of-the-Box, creativity, and never-say-die spirit!
Experience working in SMEs or managing SME accounts would be a plus

Trainees will be considered for a conversion to permanent role at the end of 3 month trial.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Summary:

If you are looking for an Inspection technician job, Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in our Singapore location, this role will handle inspections and testing of received parts.

In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

Perform inspection on physical, mechanical and/or electrical properties of received parts of subassemblies according to the defined criteria and collection plan.
Accurately update and document the results of the inspections and testing.
Manage and maintain all controlled documents and inspection records.
Monitors the MRB area and processes rejected material, utilizing the Oracle Quality Module, in accordance with established procedures.
Perform first article inspection with coordinated measurement machine programming.
Develops and conducts training as required.
Coordinates efforts with other work groups in understanding inspection methods/issues.
Assist in the construction and/or revision inspection procedures, work instructions and checklists.
Takes initiative to identify and resolve root causes of problems relating to inspection procedures, disposition of defective material or problems with parts received.
Monitor and coordinate calibration of all measuring equipment, fixtures and critical operation equipment and instrumentation.
Assist in control of documents and records; conduct periodical document process audits.
Assist in other tasks as assigned by the superior.

Who You Are:

You stay aligned with your goals and stay productive. You display a can-do attitude in good and bad times. You understand the importance and interdependence of internal customer relationships. You understand the importance and interdependence of internal customer relationships. You persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks.

For This Role, You Will Need:

NITEC/Higher NITEC/Diploma in Engineering with at least 3 to 5 years of work experience in inspection environment.
Able to read & understand engineering drawings and knowledge on Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerance (GD&T).
Proficient in regular dimensional measuring instruments and able to use Co-ordinated Measuring Machine (CMM) & Smartscope.
Demonstrate knowledge in material certification, sampling plan, non-conformance handling process.

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:

Possess good interpersonal and strong communication skills.

Our Offer to You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.

We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship .

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.

Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .

Graduate Trainee (Financial Lines) – Allianz Commercial Graduate Program 2024


Let’s care for tomorrow.
Your ambitions. Your dreams. Your tomorrow


At Allianz Commercial, we are the global leader for insuring corporate and specialty risks in the Allianz Group. Whether it is aircraft, satellites, the world’s biggest ships and tallest building, cyber-attacks or climate change impacts, Allianz Commercial has the major risks covered when it comes to protecting businesses.


We are looking for a Graduate Trainee (Financial Lines) to join our Allianz Commercial Graduate Program, based in Singapore.


Our Opportunity:


Commencing on 01 July 2024, this is your chance to kick-start your career in the insurance industry and begin an exciting journey with Allianz Commercial. We are on the lookout for dynamic individuals eager to learn, grow, and make a real impact to our organization. In return, during your first year with us, you can expect extensive training alongside meaningful on the job learning opportunities.


Our Team:


To become a Financial Lines underwriter, there is the technical aspect of risk analysis, terms, and pricing setting, it is also about building and management market relationships with brokers, cedants and clients. Analytical mindset and interpersonal skills are equally important.


Key Responsibilities


Underwrite new and renewal accounts including risk analysis, proactively prepare relevant underwriting information including client/market research and claims data.
Assist in pricing of risks, setting terms and conditions where appropriate.
Marketing and negotiating with brokers to close deals.
Develop and maintain strong relationship with key broking partners, clients as well as internal stakeholders.
Compliance with internal underwriting and governance processes, documentation, and administration requirements.


Key Experience / Requirements / Skills


Expected to graduate with a university degree by June 2024 in a related field (Accountancy, Business, Economics, Finance etc.).
Fluency in English is mandatory and fluency in other Asian languages is advantageous.
Knowledge or prior experience in an insurance related company is advantageous.
Strong desire to learn the ropes in preparation for a career in the insurance industry.
Strong problem-solving abilities, including demonstrated tenacity at data mining to discover root causes of results is advantageous.
Team player with strong service quality mind-set, adaptable, analytical, independent, meticulous, proactive, reliable, resilient, self-motivated, and willing to learn.
Very strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).


Further Information:


Duration: This is a permanent opportunity. After extensive training during the first 12 months on our Graduate Programme you will continue to work within the team and benefit from the lifelong learning opportunities that Allianz Commercial offers.
Expected Start Date: 01 July 2024
Recruitment Process: The recruitment and selection process will commence in March 2024. Shortlisted candidates will be invited for case studies and interviews.
Do take note that due to the high volume of CVs received, our response time may vary, and only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Your patience and understanding is greatly appreciated. We look forward to the possibility of working together at Allianz Commercial.


What’s in it for you?


Let’s care about everything that makes you, you.
We are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment where everyone feels they belong. We offer a hybrid working model, which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working. Please feel free to discuss flexible working arrangements with us.


Let’s care for your financial well-being.
We believe in rewarding performance with a competitive compensation and benefits package.


Let’s care for your opportunities to progress.
From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery, and empowerment are fostered.


Let’s care for life’s twists and turns.
From our support for flexible working, health, and wellbeing (including private healthcare and generous parental leave benefits), to helping people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach. We've got your back.


Let’s care for our society and our planet.
With opportunities to be engaged in shaping a future that is safe, inclusive, and sustainable, we care for the tomorrows of our people, our industry, and our clients.


Care to join us?


Allianz Commercial is the Allianz Group brand serving the world’s largest consumer brands and major industry players through to family-owned enterprises forming the backbone of nations’ economies. We bring together the corporate multinational business of Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty and the commercial business of national Allianz Property & Casualty entities and provide both traditional and alternative risk transfer solutions, outstanding risk consulting and Multinational services as well as seamless claims handling. As a key strategic player in the Allianz Group network, Allianz Commercial is present in over 200 countries and in 2022 generated more than €19 billion gross premium.


Learn more about Early careers at Allianz Commercial by clicking here
Learn more about careers at Allianz Commercial by clicking here.
Learn more about Allianz Commercial by clicking here.


Allianz is an equal opportunity employer, and therefore welcomes applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic. Diversity of thinking is an important part of our culture.


People with disabilities:


We want to give all our candidates the best opportunity to succeed. If you need any adjustments to be made during the application and selection process, please email agcsglobalcareers@allianz.com


Recruitment Agencies:



Allianz Commercial has an in-house recruitment team, which focuses on sourcing great candidates directly. Allianz Commercial does not accept unsolicited resumes from agency or search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired. When we do use agencies, we have a PSL in place, so please do not contact managers directly.

Company Description


RHB Bank was established in Singapore in 1961 as UMBC Bank, prior to the country’s independence in 1965. We assumed our present name – RHB Bank Berhad Singapore (RHBS) in 1999, after a series of expansions and strategic mergers. As a bank that has been here since the beginning, we have garnered invaluable experiences and insights which we turn into innovative solutions designed to help individuals and businesses grow and progress. Throughout the decades in Singapore, we have formed lifetime relationships with our clients and partners who have made us one of the most trusted financial institutions. Together with our experiences, insights and knowledge, we now cater to a cross-section of clients with requirements ranging from personal banking to corporate financing, offering seamless solutions and growing wealth for people and businesses. Our core businesses are streamlined into Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, Corporate Banking, Asset Management, offered through RHB Bank Berhad and RHB Asset Management Pte. Ltd. As a progressive and growing financial institution, RHB Singapore sees the importance for a strong collaborative and cohesive culture while welcoming diversity in views. As part of RHB’s aim to become the employer of choice, talent and career development initiatives are put in place to ensure equal opportunities for personal development and growth among our people. We look forward to having on board talented individuals to join our dynamic and engaging team of more than 600 employees.


Job Description


Wholesale Banknotes Sales

Conduct sales and marketing calls to existing and prospective customers.
Provide market advisory and pricing.
Manage daily tasks in marketing, sales & trade execution.

Administration & Process

Escalate any problems and issues with work processes to senior sales or Unit Head for resolutions.
Assist the Unit Head in the developmental process of new product development.
Assist the Unit Head in the daily administration requirements of the desk where applicable.
Responsible to adhere to all guidelines, policies & limits.
Responsible to upgrade technical competencies where applicable.

Compliance

Responsible to be familiar with regulatory and compliance requirements of the business.
To strictly adhere to all Regulatory & Compliance requirements for the business.

Client Relationship Management

Assist to onboard of new clients, including conducting due diligence and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
Provide administrative and client service support
Respond to all client enquiries and instructions and provide resolution to most issues and requests.

Qualifications


Preferred level of Experience:

1-2 years of experience in treasury dealing for candidates with prior experience.
Bachelor's degree or diploma in finance, economics, or a related field for fresh graduates
Fresh graduates welcome to apply

Other skills required:

Some understanding of treasury products and Financial Markets.
Strong communications and presentation skills.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills.
Knowledge of financial markets, currency trading and risk management.
Ability to work under pressure and make quick decisions.
Proficiency in using financial software and trading platforms.
Understanding of regulatory compliance and risk management practices.
A proactive and results-oriented mindset.

Additional Information


RHB is a dynamic organization that promotes a work culture of high performance, where its biggest asset, the RHB-ians, are continuously developed & nurtured to their fullest potential through its robust talent management practices.


At RHB, we take PRIDE in our people and our teams. Great relationships built on trust, a 'leading it right’ environment, challenging assignments and a culture of excellence are the pillars to the dynamic and diversified workplace we call home.

Home to the world's best loved and trusted hygiene, health, and nutrition brands. Our purpose defines why we exist: to protect, heal and nurture in the relentless pursuit of a cleaner, healthier world. We are a global team united by this purpose.

Join us in our fight to make access to the highest quality hygiene, wellness, and nourishment a right and not a privilege.

Sales

Our Sales teams help to deliver Reckitt's purpose by building shared success with our customers, making access to the highest quality hygiene, wellness, and nourishment possible in-stores and online.

Within Sales, we're focused on achieving outperformance across all of our channels, operating in highly competitive categories. This focus results in a dynamic, fast paced environment where cross functional teams are encouraged to collaborate to achieve success.

We have around 10,000 sales people across the world, within market roles and ranging in areas like Field Sales, Key Accounts, Trade Marketing and Category Development.

About the role
Launch your career in sales with a dynamic internship at Reckitt! This is not your average sales role; it's a springboard into understanding the fast-paced world of sales from the inside out. As an intern in our slaes organisation, you'll learning about analysis, 4P strategy and customer engagement. You'll gain hands-on experience across diverse brands and play a supportive role in driving our business objectives.
Your responsibilities
In summary, you'll:

Gain a thorough understanding of Reckitt's expansive brand portfolio and sales techniques.
Assist with crafting and executing impactful sales strategies.
Collaborative with various teams to bolster sales efforts and achieve targets.
Engage in analysis to spot sales opportunities and understand market trends.
Contribute to providing great customer service and responding to client inquiries.
The experience we're looking for
Recent graduate in Business, Marketing, or related field, eager to forge a path in sales.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with the team and clients.
An analytical approach with a talent for interpreting data and market insights.
Resilience and adaptability within a vibrant sales environment.
Organised, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks under pressure.
The skills for success

Work under pressure, Excellent writing skills, interpersonal skills, communication skills stakeholder management, organised.

What we offer

With inclusion at the heart of everything we do, working alongside our four global Employee Resource Groups, we support our people at every step of their career journey, helping them to succeed in their own individual way.

We invest in the wellbeing of our people through parental benefits, an Employee Assistance Program to promote mental health, and life insurance for all employees globally. We have a range of other benefits in line with the local market. Through our global share plans we offer the opportunity to save and share in Reckitt's potential future successes. For eligible roles, we also offer short-term incentives to recognise, appreciate and reward your work for delivering outstanding results. You will be rewarded in line with Reckitt's pay for performance philosophy.

Equality

We recognise that in real life, great people don't always 'tick all the boxes'. That's why we hire for potential as well as experience. Even if you don't meet every point on the job description, if this role and our company feels like a good fit for you, we still want to hear from you.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability or medical condition; colour, ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion, faith; pregnancy, family status and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; sex, gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other basis protected by appropriate law.

Job Description:
Scratch is a design and build consultancy that is focused on developing holistic spaces in the built environment for residential and commercial applications.





We are looking for design oriented self-starters, with high level of attention to detail and curiosity for innovation.





Individual to be Involved in:





1. Project coordination and site planning, handling of schedule and timelines.





2. Purchasing with suppliers, and delivery coordination with quality assurance.





3. Communication with team and stakeholders with 3D and 2D CAD visualisation and drawings.





4. Client coverage and to develop a close relationship with all stakeholders throughout duration of project.





This position reports to the project leader and interfaces with design and projects team, contractors, suppliers and clients.





Technical Skills and Competencies:

Active participation in strategic planning process, including developing goals and objectives.
Active learning in project management software, while forecasting effective management of stakeholders.
Active familarisation in 2d and 3d visualisation software.
Active coordination of various subs, elements, sourcing and fabrication within the project.
Self motivated and willingness to learn.





Scratch is committed to an employee-orientated, high performance culture that emphasises empowerment, quality, continuous improvement, and the recruitment and on-going development of a superior workplace.





This position is open for both recent graduates and mid-career individuals (mature and non mature).





Graduates interested in this position should possess a Degree and above qualification.





Mid-career individuals from any qualification level can apply.

Work-life balance, essential financial knowledge, attractive remunerations

We are looking for university students or fresh graduates in Singapore to join us as a Student Financial Advisor. Are you are looking to kickstart your career, or seeking a meaningful role while studying?

This role offers flexible work arrangement, equipping you with essential knowledge on financial planning, along with attractive remunerations. Fret not, training & mentorship will be provided. Connect with us and explore a fulfilling career in financial advisory.





A day in the life of our Student Financial Advisor:

Financial Strategy Development: Understanding your clients’ financial situations & goals to devise strategies that cater to their needs.
Insurance and Financial Advisory: Provide a holistic approach on insurance and financial planning in areas such as retirement, education, and investments supported by our comprehensive product suite.
Financial Analysis: Prepare and present financial summaries, investment reports, and income projections for clients.
Client Relationship Management: Build strong relationships through regular reviews to adapt clients’ financial plans to life changes.
Client Networking: Establish and grow a strong client base through networking & prospecting.

Benefits & Rewards:

Tailored Training: Gain essential CMFAS certifications and skills through structured courses, with mentoring from dedicated managers.
Student Funding Programme: Benefit from our corporate financing scheme specifically designed for university students, supporting you in the first 24 months of your career.
Attractive Rewards: Embrace our 'work hard, play hard' work ethos, with incentives for top performers.
Attractive Income Structure: Earn attractive income through a multi-layered incentive system, including commissions, performance incentives, annual bonuses, and exclusive incentive trips.

Qualifications:

Singaporeans preferred
Minimum 21 years old with Polytechnic Diploma, GCE 'A' level Certification or Degree in any field.
Result-oriented & highly-motivated.
Strong interpersonal skills with a strong passion to serve.

Ideal for University Students:

Flexible Working Hours: Suitable for students.
Entrepreneurial Experience: Experience how to manage and grow your own business.

Job Description:
About Us:

Quintessential Education (QE) is Singapore’s leading provider of pre-tertiary academic programmes and university admissions advisory for IGCSE and IB students. Over the past 7 years, we have built a strong presence on a high-price, high-quality positioning. We are a fast-growing business looking for a dedicated and talented addition to our team. We are committed to providing an industry-defining service to help our students achieve academic excellence, ignite opportunities and guide them towards success.

We are looking for committed and talented additions to our team. As an ideal candidate, you should display a proven ability to develop and maintain an environment of trust, diversity, and inclusion within your community.

As part of the position, you will work with the founders, Ivy League and Oxbridge graduates and other high-performing teammates. You will help address students’ learning needs and academic success by providing guidance, review, and relevant help to students in a professional manner from beginning to end.

What You'll Learn

Build your teaching skills
Receive mentorship from senior tutors on good pedagogy and teaching methods
Take ownership and ensure that the teachings align consistently with the company’s teaching methodologies
Improve your presentation and communication skills
A fulfilling mentoring experience to make a difference in someone’s life

Job Responsibilities:

The tutor is to conduct his or her duties in a professional manner. He or she must provide syllabus guidance, review of weak concepts, timed exam practices, and targeted homework and feedback to each student.

Job Requirements:

We are seeking full-time or part-time junior tutors for IB/IGCSE English. One should have:

Excellent verbal and written communication in English
Good attitude and sense of responsibility
Keen eye for detail
Ability to teach both individual and group classes
Able to create resources
Tutors should ideally have relevant experience teaching English at IB, IGCSE, and/or MYP level
Fresh IB graduates are welcome
Proficient in English. Ideally, an IB graduate with a predicted score of >42 Points and 7 in English.

What qualities we are looking

Good attitude to learn and improve
Keen eye for detail
Good time management and organization skills
Able to work independently
Provision of digitized notes to students for ease of revision
Sense of responsibility to nurture each student

Remuneration

Allowance: $50 per hour upwards

Commitment: Freelance, can start immediately. Full-time Conversion/ Internship available for discussion.

Office Location: 545 Orchard Road, #14-06/09, S238882

Job Description

ADM unlocks the power of nature to enrich the quality of life. We’re a premier global human and animal nutrition company, delivering solutions today with an eye to the future. We’re blazing new trails in health and well-being as our scientists develop groundbreaking products to support healthier living. We’re a cutting-edge innovator leading the way to a new future of plant-based consumer and industrial solutions to replace petroleum-based products. We’re an unmatched agricultural supply chain manager and processor, providing food security by connecting local needs with global capabilities. And we’re a leader in sustainability, scaling across entire value chains to help decarbonize our industry and safeguard our planet. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional and sustainability challenges of today and tomorrow. Learn more at www.adm.com.

Your Responsibilities
The ADM Finance team plays a key role in the success of the business, providing management and stakeholders with high-quality, accurate, and timely financial information and analysis for both business support and development and external reporting requirements. To successfully deliver a world class service to the business, ADM seeks high caliber team players able to gain the depth and breadth of skills across different cultures in a progressive training program designed to equip you with the skills and experience required to become a first-class finance professional.

Talented graduates are our finance professionals and ultimately our finance leaders of tomorrow. Therefore, the development of young talent is critical for the success of our organization. As program participant, you will gain experience in an international environment within our Business Unit Finance, Global Business Services and Centers of Excellence functions. As Finance Trainee, you will have exposure to senior finance leaders in ADM.

Our program is designed for two years (plus optional 6 months) rotation in different finance functions. You will work closely with our highly skilled and experienced finance management professionals during your rotations. Our finance functions include the following: Global Business Services, Business Unit Controlling, Business Unit Financial Planning and Analysis, Statutory Accounting, Treasury, Credit and Tax. You will rotate to most of these functions for 3-6 months. The program offers you prospects for an international career and the chance to play an important role in the ADM finance organization.

After successfully completing our APAC Finance Trainee program, you are ready to take on a challenging role in the ADM finance function you will be assigned to.

Your Profile
Bachelor’s degree, ideally in finance, business or related discipline with a genuine interest for agribusiness, human nutrition and animal nutrition industry.
Fluent in English (spoken and written), an additional Asian language is an advantage
Internationally mobile – willing to accept assignments in different countries
Strong Team Player with excellent collaboration skills across different stakeholders
Strong interest to learn all aspects of finance and highly motivated to develop a finance career in a regional and global environment.
Proven ability to communicate confidently and effectively
Entrepreneurial, hands-on and self-motivated with a strong drive for success and continuous improvement
Attention to details and possess an aptitude for finanical data analysis and reporting
Advance proficiency in Microsoft Office skills such as complex formulas with Excel, pivots, lookups. Experience with Power BI, VBA, Access, Power Query or even Python is an added advantage.



Your Future Perspective
Challenging tasks, short decision-making processes and a high level of personal responsibility
Room for innovative thinking and growth with the possibility to manage your own career path.
A company culture which promotes continuous learning and diversity.
Excellent career opportunities in a world leading nutrition company.

#IncludingYou

Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are cornerstones of ADM’s efforts to continue innovating, driving growth, and delivering outstanding performance. We are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce and create welcoming, truly inclusive work environments — environments that enable every ADM colleague to feel comfortable on the job, make meaningful contributions to our success, and grow their career. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that each person can bring to ADM because we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better, together.

For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM.

About The Role
Are you a wizard amongst your friends in the tech space?
Have you got analytical skills to share with the world?
Do you dream of turning your passion into a career?


The most in-demand industry right now is calling you
Learn real-world technical skills to boost your CV
Company culture committed to diversity, inclusion & fun

Job Title: Global Supply Chain New College Graduates Program
Job Description:
Overview

Applied Materials New College Graduates (NCG) Program is a 16-month inter-department training program with the aim to nurture future leader for Applied’s Global Supply Chain organization. The NCG program consists of structured training modules providing learning opportunities through classroom trainings and interactions with experienced colleagues. The participants will rotate through positions in Purchasing, Sourcing, and Commodity Management, all while developing the technical and business skills required to be successful in the Supply Chain organization.

General Profile

Performs routine assignments in the entry level to a professional job progression. Typically has knowledge of and exposure to fundamental theories, principles and concepts. Develops competence by performing structured work assignments. Uses existing procedures to solve routine or standard problems. Receives instruction, guidance and direction from other team members.

Key Responsibilities

Engages new supplier introduction and/or disengagement requirements to/from the Applied Materials supply base.

Supports the maintenance of agreements with suppliers that provide the structure for all business relationships between Applied Materials and the supply base.

Develops strategies to procure components at the lowest cost consistent with consideration of quality, reliability of source and urgency of need.

Assists in creation of commodity road maps and implements commodity strategies.

Supports new product development program and PLC process to ensure alignment with Applied’s commodity strategies.

Drives material cost reduction projects. Activities include but not limited to supplier negotiations, collaboration with engineering on design optimization and should costing.

Assists in supplier price and delivery negotiations; under direct supervision may negotiate contracts as necessary.

Utilizes the preferred supplier selection and assessment process when selecting suppliers; Completes supplier risk assessment on critical and unique parts; Monitors supplier performance (delivery, quality, cost).

Drives resolution to systematic supply chain issues affecting quality, cost, delivery or lead-time.

Drives initiatives on process improvement, optimization and digitalization of work processes within GSC community.

Under direct supervision, forecasts and communicates engineering, materials, and manufacturing requirements to suppliers. Coordinates demand signals through MRP to minimize inventory exposure.

Review and resolve material shortages to ensure continuity of production activities.

Provides input to outsourcing decisions by performing make versus buy analysis.

Requirements

Graduating with a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Business Management, Data Analytics or related field

Proficiency in developing effective executive reports and presentations

Proficiency in Microsoft office tools

Excellent listening, writing, quantitative, qualitative and oral communication skills

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact cross-organizationally

Ability to problem-solve creatively and analytically

Detail-oriented; ability to multi-task; deadline-oriented

Flexible and adaptable mindset

Thrive in a results-driven culture

Company Name: THE BALLET & MUSIC COMPANY PTE. LTD.

Job Description:
Job Summary:

If you are looking for a new opportunity in the field of Order Administration and Project Management, Emerson has an opening for you! We are seeking for Customer Support Representative who will handle accurate and timely administration of customer orders. The role will ensure orders are met and in compliance with customer requirements, product specifications and all Emerson policies.

In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

Coordinate with all relevant internal and external partners to manage all aspects of orders to meet customer’s expectations and internal important metrics.
Provide timely updates and accurate status reports throughout the entire order process to both internal and external partners.
Coordinate with vendors, factories, purchasing department, other functional teams, and review BI reports to get order status and support prioritization.
Support resolution of customer’s inquiries and adherence to customer request date.
Manage customer’s change orders, update ERP systems appropriately.
Ensure customer’s orders booked timely and accurately in ERP systems, coordinate with relevant partners to release all the necessary holds.
Being a gate keeper to ensure customer’s orders are align with Emerson booking, Trade Compliance, Due Diligence, and other necessary policies set forth.
Support all necessary month end closing activities.
Coordinate with internal partners and customers to support the resolution of finance, quality, billing, and other order related issues.
Submit customers' required documents timely through ERP system.
Coordinate with relevant partners to arrange and release the shipment timely from customer and internal systems, ensure invoice customer accordingly and accurately.
Archive all necessary documents and support for both internal and external audits.
Manage, maintain, and update various Emerson business software and ERP systems timely, accurately, and appropriately.
Any other necessary activities need to be done to meet the business’s needs and objectives.

Customer and Sales Office Communication:

Work with subject matter expert to respond to customer inquiries within 24 hours.

Managing Orders:

Proactively manage customer’s order, provide updates timely and accurately to both internal & external partners.
Ensure all orders are managed and have been entered timely and accurately to ERP systems, ensure correct product specification, agreed delivery date, certification, and documentation requirements and other necessary information.
Ensure all the holds placed on orders to be released appropriately and timely.
Ensure all Emerson policies and procedures to be complied.
Resolve all issues relate to the orders timely and appropriately to meet customer’s expectations and internal important metrics.
Conduct, manage and attend all necessary business meetings, visits, and travels.

Communication of shipping, resolve invoicing issues:

Coordinate inspection if required.
Prepare shipping documents, coordinate with internal and external partners to arrange and release the shipment timely.
Coordinate with internal partners and customers to ensure the shipment ship timely and invoice customer on time.

Status Updates:

Assist in sales shipment forecasting and update the ERP systems timely and accurately.
Provide status reports as required on order status.
Follow up on commitments and delivery achievements with the plant.
Provide the orders’ execution progress throughout the entire order process.

Change Order Management:

Provide technical and application support for customer inquiries.
Manage change order process.

Who You Are:

You adjust communication content and style to meet the needs of diverse partners. You always keep the end in sight; puts in extra effort to meet deadlines. You facilitate an open dialogue with a wide variety of contributors and partners.

For This Role, You Will Need:

Degree or equivalent in Business Management, Supply Chain or any related field
Minimum 2 years of work experience in customer facing role.
Strong customer support skills; strong communication (written and verbal) skills.
Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities.

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:

Proficient in a variety of software programs including customer relationship management and ERP software.
Proficient in both SAP and Oracle will be an advantage.
Ability to comprehend technical specifications.
Ability to adapt in changes and fast-paced working environment, can work under the pressure and patient and resilient

Our Offer to You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.

We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship .

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.

Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .




WHY EMERSON

Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.

At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.

ABOUT EMERSON

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!

No calls or agencies please.

Job Location

Singapore

Job Description

Overview of the Job:

Do you enjoy answering tough business questions using insights and analytical skills or have a passion in the media and digital marketing space? If this sounds like fun, we would love to hire someone with your skills!

The Media Science Manager will lead how to win in media platforms, sustain and build digital marketing capabilities and lead innovation in the media and digital marketing space to grow our brands awareness and sales for the region of Asia Pacific, Middle East and Africa.

The individual’s work scope will include a mix of data analytics and insights working closely with Market Media Operations and Marketing teams to drive incremental media reach, effectiveness and bringing down media costs through efficiency ideas.

Once the individual grows as our trusted internal expert on Digital Media, the individual will also lead the upskilling our organizations’ capability on their areas of expertise and continue to build their own expertise through connecting externally in the industry to bring new ideas in and through the company’s internal network.

This role will be based in Singapore.

Your Team:

You will report to the Analytics & Insights Director for Media Science. You will work extensively with colleagues from Marketing, Communications, and Media Operations across P&G offices in Asia Pacific, Middle East, and Africa.

How success looks like:
Improve brand sales and awareness through media reach, effectiveness and cost improvement.
Upskill the organization on core Digital Media capabilities
Step up our digital campaigns across media platforms such as Youtube, Tiktok, Instagram, OTT etc.. including KOL/influencer-led content.
Propose Digital Creative/Content guidelines hinged on strong consumer understanding of their Media behavior and needs and preferences related to P&G’s product categories.
Responsibilities of the Role:
Propose strategic interventions on the media space
Identify and build solutions and/or algorithms to step up the performance of media campaigns leveraging data analysis, performance of existing campaigns and leading experiments
Deliver strong data-based and insight-based recommendations on how to win with our P&G target consumers through winning digital media content by platform (eg. Social Media and YouTube Content and Media Plans)
Be a trusted internal Digital Media expert consultant for Brand Managers and Media Operations Teams
Define and map out an innovative plan to stay ahead in this space
Bring Media Led-amplification opportunities for Brands, derive learning, share and re-apply across categories and across the region.

Job Qualifications

Undergraduate or Masters’ Degree.
Deep understanding of the media landscape and Strong analytical ability to develop data-driven and insight-based media strategies.
Have worked in Media, Agency or FMCG client side, especially International Companies. Experience in working on Social Media & YouTube Advertising campaigns. Experience working with KOLs/Influencers is an advantage.
Experience in Consumer Insights/Market Research is a plus.
Able to handle and analyze complex and large amounts of data leveraging excellent MS Excel skills and/or Python and various modeling approaches
Curiosity and passion to learn and explore new media/advertising formats (ie. Social Commerce) and new tools to analyze data (eg. Gen AI)
High collaboration skills with internal multi-functional teams and external partners and work across geographies and cultures
Strong leadership skills and Ability to lead change and drive innovation
Comfortable in operating in a complex, fast paced and agile structure with an ability to handle multiple priorities
About us

We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being “in touch” so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world’s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

At A*STAR Graduate Academy (A*GA), our vision is to make A*STAR a global nexus for scientific talent. We are committed to nurturing and grooming a new generation of talented scientists and researchers who will spearhead Singapore's ambition of becoming a world class scientific hub. Through a comprehensive suite of undergraduate, PhD and post-doctoral scholarships.

A*GA supports top-class education at both local and overseas universities/ institutions to help passionate individuals realise their full potential. We also identify budding scientific talents through extensive outreach programmes and internships to nurture them into future scientific talents.

This role is under the Shared Services (SS) branch, which is a centralized hub to support administrative and operational requirements for scholarships, awards and internships.

Carry out covering duties as a personal assistant to the Executive Director of A*GA

We are looking for university students or fresh graduates in Singapore to join us as a Student Financial Advisor. Are you are looking to kickstart your career, or seeking a meaningful role while studying?

This role offers flexible work arrangement, equipping you with essential knowledge on financial planning, along with attractive remunerations. Fret not, training & mentorship will be provided. Connect with us and explore a fulfilling career in financial advisory.





A day in the life of our Student Financial Advisor:

Financial Strategy Development: Understanding your clients’ financial situations & goals to devise strategies that cater to their needs.
Insurance and Financial Advisory: Provide a holistic approach on insurance and financial planning in areas such as retirement, education, and investments supported by our comprehensive product suite.
Financial Analysis: Prepare and present financial summaries, investment reports, and income projections for clients.
Client Relationship Management: Build strong relationships through regular reviews to adapt clients’ financial plans to life changes.
Client Networking: Establish and grow a strong client base through networking & prospecting.

Benefits & Rewards:

Tailored Training: Gain essential CMFAS certifications and skills through structured courses, with mentoring from dedicated managers.
Student Funding Programme: Benefit from our corporate financing scheme specifically designed for university students, supporting you in the first 24 months of your career.
Attractive Rewards: Embrace our 'work hard, play hard' work ethos, with incentives for top performers.
Attractive Income Structure: Earn attractive income through a multi-layered incentive system, including commissions, performance incentives, annual bonuses, and exclusive incentive trips.

Qualifications:

Singaporeans preferred
Minimum 21 years old with Polytechnic Diploma, GCE 'A' level Certification or Degree in any field.
Result-oriented & highly-motivated.
Strong interpersonal skills with a strong passion to serve.

Ideal for University Students:

Flexible Working Hours: Suitable for students.
Entrepreneurial Experience: Experience how to manage and grow your own business.
Mentorship from Success Stories: Guided by mentors who began their successful careers as students, including one who earned S$90K/month during their days at NUS.
Apply now and kickstart your career in financial advisory!

Job Title: Administrative and Office Support Student Trainee
Job Description:
Duties

The Administrative and Office Support Student Trainee is responsible for assisting in administrative and office support work as it relates to management, program and administrative analysis, and process evaluation.

The student trainee performs a mixture of routine and somewhat complex tasks under the general direction of a manager, project/ program manager, team leader, or other more experienced employee. The work activities typically support the work of other employees and contribute to the activities of the organizational unit.

The student works with teams working on mission-related projects. Engages in meaningful learning and development activities while applying basic knowledge and limited experience in performing tasks. Assists manager and other employees in day-to-day operations.

Works with more experienced team members in compiling and consolidating data, computing or verifying the accuracy of budget data and inform more experienced team member, team lead, project/program manager or manager of discrepancies. Identifies discrepancies and data omissions and regularly refers these problems and work issues to a manager, project/program manager, team leader, or more experienced employee for guidance.

Receives detailed instructions from a manager, project/program manager, team leader, or more experienced employee as to performing specific tasks such as, searching historical files for readily available background information such as recent staff or function changes, organizational charts, mission and function statements, and position descriptions. Supports higher level employees in the design of organization and workflow charts, using graphic design software.

Assists and supports the day-to-day operation by entering and tracking fiscal data using a variety of automation tools such as Delphi, US Bank, PRISM, Castle, Travel (E2). Uses one or more established automated systems to enter and retrieve factual information, gather data for use in reports, charts or graphs. Assists in maintaining filing systems, supplies, equipment, and publications; help to ensure office handbooks, orders, directives are maintained and kept current, as directed.

Contacts are primarily internal to one organizational unit to share basic information and to receive guidance. In some areas, may have limited contacts with external customers. Work is reviewed regularly during assignments and at completion to ensure timeliness and all aspects of quality.

Other features of the Gateways Internship Program

APPOINTMENT - If selected, your appointment may not exceed a total of 120 days after completing educational requirements. Participation in this program may be terminated at any time.

AGREEMENT: All participants must sign a written Gateways Internship Agreement with their manager that clearly identifies expectations of the appointment such as duties, length of appointment, work schedule, training, mentorship etc.

CONVERSION: Although not guaranteed, an intern may be converted from the Internship Program to a permanent appointment without further competition in accordance with established policy. Conversion must occur within 120 days after successful completion of the educational program (awarding of diploma, certificate, or degree), completion of a minimum of 640 hours of career-related work experience, required training, mentorship, and other requirements in accordance with the intern’s participant agreement. Additionally, the intern must meet qualification requirements and any other position requirements associated with the position to which converted. The intern must be converted to an occupation related to his/her academic training and career-related work experience as outlined in their participant agreement.
