Job Title: Design and Project Manager (Interior and full builds)
Job Description:
Scratch is a design and build consultancy that is focused on developing holistic spaces in the built environment for residential and commercial applications.





We are looking for design oriented self-starters, with high level of attention to detail and curiosity for innovation.





Individual to be Involved in:





1. Project coordination and site planning, handling of schedule and timelines.





2. Purchasing with suppliers, and delivery coordination with quality assurance.





3. Communication with team and stakeholders with 3D and 2D CAD visualisation and drawings.





4. Client coverage and to develop a close relationship with all stakeholders throughout duration of project.





This position reports to the project leader and interfaces with design and projects team, contractors, suppliers and clients.





Technical Skills and Competencies:

Active participation in strategic planning process, including developing goals and objectives.
Active learning in project management software, while forecasting effective management of stakeholders.
Active familarisation in 2d and 3d visualisation software.
Active coordination of various subs, elements, sourcing and fabrication within the project.
Self motivated and willingness to learn.





Scratch is committed to an employee-orientated, high performance culture that emphasises empowerment, quality, continuous improvement, and the recruitment and on-going development of a superior workplace.





This position is open for both recent graduates and mid-career individuals (mature and non mature).





Graduates interested in this position should possess a Degree and above qualification.





Mid-career individuals from any qualification level can apply.





Interns can apply for traineeship positions.

Work-life balance, essential financial knowledge, attractive remunerations

We are looking for university students or fresh graduates in Singapore to join us as a Student Financial Advisor. Are you are looking to kickstart your career, or seeking a meaningful role while studying?

This role offers flexible work arrangement, equipping you with essential knowledge on financial planning, along with attractive remunerations. Fret not, training & mentorship will be provided. Connect with us and explore a fulfilling career in financial advisory.





A day in the life of our Student Financial Advisor:

Financial Strategy Development: Understanding your clients’ financial situations & goals to devise strategies that cater to their needs.
Insurance and Financial Advisory: Provide a holistic approach on insurance and financial planning in areas such as retirement, education, and investments supported by our comprehensive product suite.
Financial Analysis: Prepare and present financial summaries, investment reports, and income projections for clients.
Client Relationship Management: Build strong relationships through regular reviews to adapt clients’ financial plans to life changes.
Client Networking: Establish and grow a strong client base through networking & prospecting.

Benefits & Rewards:

Tailored Training: Gain essential CMFAS certifications and skills through structured courses, with mentoring from dedicated managers.
Student Funding Programme: Benefit from our corporate financing scheme specifically designed for university students, supporting you in the first 24 months of your career.
Attractive Rewards: Embrace our 'work hard, play hard' work ethos, with incentives for top performers.
Attractive Income Structure: Earn attractive income through a multi-layered incentive system, including commissions, performance incentives, annual bonuses, and exclusive incentive trips.

Qualifications:

Singaporeans preferred
Minimum 21 years old with Polytechnic Diploma, GCE 'A' level Certification or Degree in any field.
Result-oriented & highly-motivated.
Strong interpersonal skills with a strong passion to serve.

Ideal for University Students:

Flexible Working Hours: Suitable for students.
Entrepreneurial Experience: Experience how to manage and grow your own business.
Mentorship from Success Stories: Guided by mentors who began their successful careers as students, including one who earned S$90K/month during their days at NUS.
Apply now and kickstart your career in financial advisory!

Excellent verbal and written communication in English

Job Description

ADM unlocks the power of nature to enrich the quality of life. We’re a premier global human and animal nutrition company, delivering solutions today with an eye to the future. We’re blazing new trails in health and well-being as our scientists develop groundbreaking products to support healthier living. We’re a cutting-edge innovator leading the way to a new future of plant-based consumer and industrial solutions to replace petroleum-based products. We’re an unmatched agricultural supply chain manager and processor, providing food security by connecting local needs with global capabilities. And we’re a leader in sustainability, scaling across entire value chains to help decarbonize our industry and safeguard our planet. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional and sustainability challenges of today and tomorrow. Learn more at www.adm.com.

Your Responsibilities
The ADM Finance team plays a key role in the success of the business, providing management and stakeholders with high-quality, accurate, and timely financial information and analysis for both business support and development and external reporting requirements. To successfully deliver a world class service to the business, ADM seeks high caliber team players able to gain the depth and breadth of skills across different cultures in a progressive training program designed to equip you with the skills and experience required to become a first-class finance professional.

Talented graduates are our finance professionals and ultimately our finance leaders of tomorrow. Therefore, the development of young talent is critical for the success of our organization. As program participant, you will gain experience in an international environment within our Business Unit Finance, Global Business Services and Centers of Excellence functions. As Finance Trainee, you will have exposure to senior finance leaders in ADM.

Our program is designed for two years (plus optional 6 months) rotation in different finance functions. You will work closely with our highly skilled and experienced finance management professionals during your rotations. Our finance functions include the following: Global Business Services, Business Unit Controlling, Business Unit Financial Planning and Analysis, Statutory Accounting, Treasury, Credit and Tax. You will rotate to most of these functions for 3-6 months. The program offers you prospects for an international career and the chance to play an important role in the ADM finance organization.

After successfully completing our APAC Finance Trainee program, you are ready to take on a challenging role in the ADM finance function you will be assigned to.

Your Profile
Bachelor’s degree, ideally in finance, business or related discipline with a genuine interest for agribusiness, human nutrition and animal nutrition industry.
Fluent in English (spoken and written), an additional Asian language is an advantage
Internationally mobile – willing to accept assignments in different countries
Strong Team Player with excellent collaboration skills across different stakeholders
Strong interest to learn all aspects of finance and highly motivated to develop a finance career in a regional and global environment.
Proven ability to communicate confidently and effectively
Entrepreneurial, hands-on and self-motivated with a strong drive for success and continuous improvement
Attention to details and possess an aptitude for finanical data analysis and reporting
Advance proficiency in Microsoft Office skills such as complex formulas with Excel, pivots, lookups. Experience with Power BI, VBA, Access, Power Query or even Python is an added advantage.



Your Future Perspective
Challenging tasks, short decision-making processes and a high level of personal responsibility
Room for innovative thinking and growth with the possibility to manage your own career path.
A company culture which promotes continuous learning and diversity.
Excellent career opportunities in a world leading nutrition company.

#IncludingYou

Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are cornerstones of ADM’s efforts to continue innovating, driving growth, and delivering outstanding performance. We are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce and create welcoming, truly inclusive work environments — environments that enable every ADM colleague to feel comfortable on the job, make meaningful contributions to our success, and grow their career. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that each person can bring to ADM because we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better, together.

For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM.

Job Title: Global Supply Chain New College Graduates Program
Job Description:
Overview

Applied Materials New College Graduates (NCG) Program is a 16-month inter-department training program with the aim to nurture future leader for Applied’s Global Supply Chain organization. The NCG program consists of structured training modules providing learning opportunities through classroom trainings and interactions with experienced colleagues. The participants will rotate through positions in Purchasing, Sourcing, and Commodity Management, all while developing the technical and business skills required to be successful in the Supply Chain organization.

General Profile

Performs routine assignments in the entry level to a professional job progression. Typically has knowledge of and exposure to fundamental theories, principles and concepts. Develops competence by performing structured work assignments. Uses existing procedures to solve routine or standard problems. Receives instruction, guidance and direction from other team members.

Key Responsibilities

Engages new supplier introduction and/or disengagement requirements to/from the Applied Materials supply base.

Supports the maintenance of agreements with suppliers that provide the structure for all business relationships between Applied Materials and the supply base.

Develops strategies to procure components at the lowest cost consistent with consideration of quality, reliability of source and urgency of need.

Assists in creation of commodity road maps and implements commodity strategies.

Supports new product development program and PLC process to ensure alignment with Applied’s commodity strategies.

Drives material cost reduction projects. Activities include but not limited to supplier negotiations, collaboration with engineering on design optimization and should costing.

Assists in supplier price and delivery negotiations; under direct supervision may negotiate contracts as necessary.

Utilizes the preferred supplier selection and assessment process when selecting suppliers; Completes supplier risk assessment on critical and unique parts; Monitors supplier performance (delivery, quality, cost).

Drives resolution to systematic supply chain issues affecting quality, cost, delivery or lead-time.

Drives initiatives on process improvement, optimization and digitalization of work processes within GSC community.

Under direct supervision, forecasts and communicates engineering, materials, and manufacturing requirements to suppliers. Coordinates demand signals through MRP to minimize inventory exposure.

Review and resolve material shortages to ensure continuity of production activities.

Provides input to outsourcing decisions by performing make versus buy analysis.

Requirements

Graduating with a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Business Management, Data Analytics or related field

Proficiency in developing effective executive reports and presentations

Proficiency in Microsoft office tools

Excellent listening, writing, quantitative, qualitative and oral communication skills

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact cross-organizationally

Ability to problem-solve creatively and analytically

Detail-oriented; ability to multi-task; deadline-oriented

Flexible and adaptable mindset

Thrive in a results-driven culture

Job Description:
Job Summary:

If you are looking for a new opportunity in the field of Order Administration and Project Management, Emerson has an opening for you! We are seeking for Customer Support Representative who will handle accurate and timely administration of customer orders. The role will ensure orders are met and in compliance with customer requirements, product specifications and all Emerson policies.

In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

Coordinate with all relevant internal and external partners to manage all aspects of orders to meet customer’s expectations and internal important metrics.
Provide timely updates and accurate status reports throughout the entire order process to both internal and external partners.
Coordinate with vendors, factories, purchasing department, other functional teams, and review BI reports to get order status and support prioritization.
Support resolution of customer’s inquiries and adherence to customer request date.
Manage customer’s change orders, update ERP systems appropriately.
Ensure customer’s orders booked timely and accurately in ERP systems, coordinate with relevant partners to release all the necessary holds.
Being a gate keeper to ensure customer’s orders are align with Emerson booking, Trade Compliance, Due Diligence, and other necessary policies set forth.
Support all necessary month end closing activities.
Coordinate with internal partners and customers to support the resolution of finance, quality, billing, and other order related issues.
Submit customers' required documents timely through ERP system.
Coordinate with relevant partners to arrange and release the shipment timely from customer and internal systems, ensure invoice customer accordingly and accurately.
Archive all necessary documents and support for both internal and external audits.
Manage, maintain, and update various Emerson business software and ERP systems timely, accurately, and appropriately.
Any other necessary activities need to be done to meet the business’s needs and objectives.

Customer and Sales Office Communication:

Work with subject matter expert to respond to customer inquiries within 24 hours.

Managing Orders:

Proactively manage customer’s order, provide updates timely and accurately to both internal & external partners.
Ensure all orders are managed and have been entered timely and accurately to ERP systems, ensure correct product specification, agreed delivery date, certification, and documentation requirements and other necessary information.
Ensure all the holds placed on orders to be released appropriately and timely.
Ensure all Emerson policies and procedures to be complied.
Resolve all issues relate to the orders timely and appropriately to meet customer’s expectations and internal important metrics.
Conduct, manage and attend all necessary business meetings, visits, and travels.

Communication of shipping, resolve invoicing issues:

Coordinate inspection if required.
Prepare shipping documents, coordinate with internal and external partners to arrange and release the shipment timely.
Coordinate with internal partners and customers to ensure the shipment ship timely and invoice customer on time.

Status Updates:

Assist in sales shipment forecasting and update the ERP systems timely and accurately.
Provide status reports as required on order status.
Follow up on commitments and delivery achievements with the plant.
Provide the orders’ execution progress throughout the entire order process.

Change Order Management:

Provide technical and application support for customer inquiries.
Manage change order process.

Who You Are:

You adjust communication content and style to meet the needs of diverse partners. You always keep the end in sight; puts in extra effort to meet deadlines. You facilitate an open dialogue with a wide variety of contributors and partners.

For This Role, You Will Need:

Degree or equivalent in Business Management, Supply Chain or any related field
Minimum 2 years of work experience in customer facing role.
Strong customer support skills; strong communication (written and verbal) skills.
Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities.

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:

Proficient in a variety of software programs including customer relationship management and ERP software.
Proficient in both SAP and Oracle will be an advantage.
Ability to comprehend technical specifications.
Ability to adapt in changes and fast-paced working environment, can work under the pressure and patient and resilient

Our Offer to You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets . We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.

We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship .

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.

Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .




WHY EMERSON

Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.

At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.

ABOUT EMERSON

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!

No calls or agencies please.

Job Location

Singapore

Job Description

Overview of the Job:

Do you enjoy answering tough business questions using insights and analytical skills or have a passion in the media and digital marketing space? If this sounds like fun, we would love to hire someone with your skills!

The Media Science Manager will lead how to win in media platforms, sustain and build digital marketing capabilities and lead innovation in the media and digital marketing space to grow our brands awareness and sales for the region of Asia Pacific, Middle East and Africa.

The individual’s work scope will include a mix of data analytics and insights working closely with Market Media Operations and Marketing teams to drive incremental media reach, effectiveness and bringing down media costs through efficiency ideas.

Once the individual grows as our trusted internal expert on Digital Media, the individual will also lead the upskilling our organizations’ capability on their areas of expertise and continue to build their own expertise through connecting externally in the industry to bring new ideas in and through the company’s internal network.

This role will be based in Singapore.

Your Team:

You will report to the Analytics & Insights Director for Media Science. You will work extensively with colleagues from Marketing, Communications, and Media Operations across P&G offices in Asia Pacific, Middle East, and Africa.

How success looks like:
Improve brand sales and awareness through media reach, effectiveness and cost improvement.
Upskill the organization on core Digital Media capabilities
Step up our digital campaigns across media platforms such as Youtube, Tiktok, Instagram, OTT etc.. including KOL/influencer-led content.
Propose Digital Creative/Content guidelines hinged on strong consumer understanding of their Media behavior and needs and preferences related to P&G’s product categories.
Responsibilities of the Role:
Propose strategic interventions on the media space
Identify and build solutions and/or algorithms to step up the performance of media campaigns leveraging data analysis, performance of existing campaigns and leading experiments
Deliver strong data-based and insight-based recommendations on how to win with our P&G target consumers through winning digital media content by platform (eg. Social Media and YouTube Content and Media Plans)
Be a trusted internal Digital Media expert consultant for Brand Managers and Media Operations Teams
Define and map out an innovative plan to stay ahead in this space
Bring Media Led-amplification opportunities for Brands, derive learning, share and re-apply across categories and across the region.

Job Qualifications

Undergraduate or Masters’ Degree.
Deep understanding of the media landscape and Strong analytical ability to develop data-driven and insight-based media strategies.
Have worked in Media, Agency or FMCG client side, especially International Companies. Experience in working on Social Media & YouTube Advertising campaigns. Experience working with KOLs/Influencers is an advantage.
Experience in Consumer Insights/Market Research is a plus.
Able to handle and analyze complex and large amounts of data leveraging excellent MS Excel skills and/or Python and various modeling approaches
Curiosity and passion to learn and explore new media/advertising formats (ie. Social Commerce) and new tools to analyze data (eg. Gen AI)
High collaboration skills with internal multi-functional teams and external partners and work across geographies and cultures
Strong leadership skills and Ability to lead change and drive innovation
Comfortable in operating in a complex, fast paced and agile structure with an ability to handle multiple priorities
About us

We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being “in touch” so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world’s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

Job Segmentation

Recent Grads/Entry Level (Job Segmentation)

At A*STAR Graduate Academy (A*GA), our vision is to make A*STAR a global nexus for scientific talent. We are committed to nurturing and grooming a new generation of talented scientists and researchers who will spearhead Singapore's ambition of becoming a world class scientific hub. Through a comprehensive suite of undergraduate, PhD and post-doctoral scholarships.

A*GA supports top-class education at both local and overseas universities/ institutions to help passionate individuals realise their full potential. We also identify budding scientific talents through extensive outreach programmes and internships to nurture them into future scientific talents.

This role is under the Shared Services (SS) branch, which is a centralized hub to support administrative and operational requirements for scholarships, awards and internships.





Responsibilities:

Support the application, issuance, and cancellation of Training Pass
Manage TEP-related inquiries from students and supervisors
Process monthly disbursements of stipends and allowances
Perform goods receipt for goods/services delivered to A*GA
Ensure timely updates to databases and departmental Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
Participate as a team member in providing user requirements, conducting user acceptance tests, etc., for ad-hoc digitalisation projects and system enhancements
Carry out covering duties as a personal assistant to the Executive Director of A*GA

Begin your engineering career by enrolling into our 26-month structured Career Advancement Programme (CAP).

This programme sets you on the pathway to become a Accredited BIM Professional for Digital Delivery Management. Your time on our programme counts towards the work experience requirement. Digital skills are crucial in the Built Environment sector. BIM is the way to digitally create and simulate building and infrastructure models before the actual construction.





AcePLP welcomes fresh graduates and mid-careerists from Architectural, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, BIM, Mechatronics and Engineering with diploma/degree to enrol in our CAP. AcePLP’s 26-months CAP aligns you to the Built Environment career trajectory. It is the most established work-study programme in Singapore with 20-years proven track record of producing thousands of engineering professionals in the Built Environment. CAP Alumni have made valuable contributions in the development and management of digital models for buildings and infrastructure. You will have opportunities to learn on-the-job alongside industry experts and build your expertise after an initial 2-months classroom training with us.





Why Join Us?

We have the most established Work-Study Programme in the Built Environment sector with over 20 years track record.

An intensive free two-month technical BIM and CAD training will be provided.
Learn on-the-job as you work across building and infrastructure projects in Singapore with guidance from our experienced Trainers and Resource Managers.
Build your expertise and widen your professional network with us through our large database of clients, project assignments and alumnus.
This program counts towards the fulfilment of pre-requisite for the SUSS Bachelor of Building and Project Management and NUS Bachelor of Technology in Engineering, as well as towards the Digital Delivery Management (BIM) accreditation.
Sponsorship from AcePLP for further studies are available subject to terms and conditions apply.
Obtain accreditation for your DDM/BIM skills and Specialist BIM Diploma and/or building related Degree after 6 years in the building industry.

Am I an Eligible Candidate?

Entry level candidates and mid-careerists may apply.
Strong interest in pursuing a career in the Built Environment Sector.
Degree/Diploma in Built Environment-related fields: Architecture, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Structural Engineering, Green Building & Sustainability, Project or Construction Management and Facilities Management.
Other qualifications considered: Any engineering subjects, Intelligent Building Technology, Graphic Arts, Visual/Product/Interior Design, Landscape Architecture, Environmental Engineering, Mechatronic, Aeronautical, etc.
Professionals with prior experience in BIM may request for a skills test to fast-track their development at AcePLP.

You can apply here: https://aces.aceplp.com.sg/apply/nt/

We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. Job Title: Graduate Trainee – Institutional Clients & Transaction Banking Sales
Job Description:
Job purpose:

An exciting opportunity for a Graduate Trainee to gain broad experience across Trade Finance and Cash Management (TFCM) to develop a complete skill set as a foundation for a Transaction Banking management career.

This 18-month Graduate Trainee program is designed for recent Graduates and applicants must have graduated within the past 12 months. Strong performance can lead to final placement in areas of Sales or Strategy/Business Management – subject to business requirements, and candidate performance during rotations / projects in these areas:

(i) Strategy and Business Management

Support the Regional Head and Local Head of Trade Finance and Cash Management in the development and implementation of the business Strategy for Asia and Singapore. Specific tasks will be involved in Strategy and target setting, initiative tracking and working with Sales/Operations teams across the region in implementation.

Develop a multi-country and comprehensive view of the business, and an understanding of market, client and regulatory trends.

(ii) Sales

Support of Sales Specialists in the overall communication with the customer and stakeholders within the organisation.

Assistance to Sales Specialists in preparation of client meetings by compiling internet research on customer and information from internal systems e.g., prepare Terms & Conditions, presentations / pitch decks.

Support in customer meetings, producing minutes and helping with any follow-up.

Independent organization and support in preparation of internal and external events and meetings.

Support the Head in planning, strategizing, implementation, execution, and reporting tasks.

Compliance with the local laws and provisions (amongst other things, regulatory requirements, labour law, tax and commercial law), as well as the relevant internal regulations of Commerzbank.





Key activities:

Strategy and Business Management

Supporting the Regional Head in executing the business development strategy, mining data to enable controlling and make meaningful adjustments.
Supporting regional projects, internal and external audits, and assist in various governance functions.

Sales

Supporting the sales team within the sales process, e.g., research and compilation of market, competitor, and potential analysis as well as product information (in complex cases).
Independently solving of customer requests in taking the bank’s economical requirements, rules and regulations as well as compliance related tasks into consideration.
Coordination of customer appointments with existing and potential corporate customers upon request of the sales team.
Supporting marketing initiatives and customer events together with the sales team.
Assisting the sales team in processing trade finance and cash management transactions for customers.
Monitor clients’ business and operations at all levels on a timely and ongoing basis to ensure business opportunities are followed up and for thorough credit and financial crime risk monitoring.
Uploading, maintaining and finalizing pipeline inputs and acknowledging market trends.





Formal education/Specialist knowledge (work experience, further qualification)

Recent graduate with not more than 1 year of professional work experience (excluding internships)
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Finance/Social Science with GPA 3.5/5 & 3.2/4.





Description of specifications with regards to work profiles:

Willingness to learn, be part of a dynamic team and make an impact and achieve results
Proactive & self-initiated quick learner, able to adapt quickly
Team player & good interpersonal skills
Strong sense of responsibility & integrity
Client centric & service oriented
Ability to work under pressure & deliver high quality output
Meticulous & Strong communicator

Process Engineer (Front and Back End) is responsible for development and establishment of production process.






Key Responsibilities

Review and accept machine buyoff, setup pilot line process and transfer from pilot line to production line.
Establish, review and update specifications, workflow, quality and safety related documentation for production line.
Troubleshoot process issue and improve process capabilities, yield and cycle time from customer NPI stage to LVM/HVM stage.
Process sustaining and control through SPC and periodic defect Pareto Analysis. Lead and drive SPC control towards zero defects. Review and update FMEA, Control plan OCAP with cross-functional teams.
Coordinate and liaise with vendor/suppliers on process issue or quality issue.
Support customer NPI activities and internal engineering activities.
New material, process & machine development and qualification.
Handle and manage customer audits and 8D reports.
Provide disposition for engineering and production lots.
Conduct process characterization and qualification to establish process baseline.





Requirement

Bachelor’s degree in Chemicals, Materials Science, microelectronics, mechanical engineering or relevant engineering degrees.
Knowledge in process engineering, process control engineering and yield enhancement would be an added advantage
Fresh graduates are welcome to apply

Operational Skills

Responsibility - Courage: I express my convictions and make decisions with courage and respect.
Innovation - Technology: I adopt new technologies in the solutions and projects I work on
Commitment - Exemplarity: I embody the Group’s values
Business insight

Company Description

Societe Generale is one of the leading European financial services groups. Founded in 1864, we have been playing a vital role in the economy for over 150 years. With more than 148,000 employees based in 76 countries worldwide, we accompany 32 million clients throughout the world on a daily basis. Based on a diversified universal banking model, the Group combines financial strength with a strategy of sustainable growth.

ASIA-PACIFIC (ASIA), as one of the Business Units of Societe Generale, operates in 12 locations across the Asia Pacific region, employing over 2,500 employees with the regional headquarter located in Hong Kong. Our activities here are centered on Societe Generale's Global Banking & Investor Solutions pole (GBIS), a major growth engine for the Group and a key pillar of Societe Generale's universal banking model. Our expertise in Asia Pacific ranges from Corporate & Investment Banking (Advisory, Financing and Global Markets) to Asset Management, Global Transaction Banking and specialised financial services like Equipment & Vendor Finance and Vehicle Leasing & Fleet Management. In addition, Societe Generale's Global Solution Centre (SGGSC) in Bangalore and Chennai offers customised business solutions to the Societe Generale Group globally including ASIA.

Department Description

Internal Audit teams are part of the Inspection and Audit division (IGAD) of SG Group. Junior Internal Auditors’ main task is to assist the Auditors in Charge in assessing the regulatory compliance of SG’s processes and transactions, making sure that all the risks are properly mitigated and that the relevant controls are in place. Junior Internal Auditors participate to audit assignments covering risks areas as per the audit plan. They apply IGAD processes and methodologies, and use the tools supporting the audit cycle. A strong emphasis is made on the use of data analytics tools, which trainees quickly get familiarized to. They also assist the Head of Audit on specific assignments.

Internal Audit is a key department, helping the Group to better identify, prevent and manage its risks. It is a privileged place for a young professional who wants to have 360 degrees view on the Bank’s businesses and processes and develop highly recognized methodological skills.

We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

Job Description

The Singapore Airlines Mobile application (available under “Singapore Airlines” on the Google Play Store) vision is to be the trusted travel companion for SIA passengers, offering features covering the customer journey from booking, pre-flight, day of travel, in flight and post flight.

The SIA Mobile team is currently hiring Android developers. This is a full-time role with a hybrid WFH / Work from office arrangement, and includes travel benefits, access to ongoing learning, and an attractive work-life balance.

Key Responsibilities

Work with our team of Product Managers, Product Owners, UX Designers, QA, and Developers to build, optimise and release features within the SIA Mobile application.
Ensure the application features operate smoothly in production and deliver world class customer experience to our large base of monthly users.
Learn and apply principles of Test Driven Development, Agile Methodologies, Extreme Programming and MVP/MVVM architecture to deliver highly usable, stable and maintainable code.
Learn and work with a tech stack comprising best-of-breed tools such as Kotlin, Git, Jenkins CI/CD, Sonarqube, automated test tools, a Java/Node.js back end, and AWS to deliver a monthly release of the mobile application.
Integrate with a range of SIA’s backend systems using integration tech such as REST and JSON.
Contribute to building a culture of openness, belonging, mutual support, ongoing learning, continuous improvement, enablement, and engineering excellence.
Operations and L2 support work after hours may be needed from time to time. This will be kept to a minimum and shared across the team to ensure a sustainable work/life balance.
Any relevant ad-hoc duties.

Requirements

Possess a degree in Information Technology or related fields
Hands on experience with Android development is preferred. Recent graduates with no industry experience, or developers experienced in other tech stacks are welcome to apply if they wish to grow a career in mobile development.
A willingness to learn and apply best practices in Android (Kotlin) development, Extreme Programming principles, Pair Programming, Test Driven Development, DevOps, and defensive programming.
Ability to communicate fluently in English. The team is a diverse team, and strong written and verbal English communication is essential to daily work.

We thank all candidates for your interest in Singapore Airlines, and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Summary

If you are a Supply Chain professional, looking to expand your career in the Manufacturing space, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! The Material Planner will be responsible for the material flow planning to meet the daily production requirements of the business. The role will also handle inventory records maintenance, stock discrepancies resolution, stock movement monitoring, purchase orders, and issues coordination with finance and suppliers.



In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

Inventory Control

Plan material flow to meet daily production requirements.
Implement and complete inventory reduction programs
Monitor & expedite orders based on material requirement & inventory levels.
Achieve Inventory important metric set by management. (5 points ITO, Average Inventory and Raw velocity)
Process and maintain inventory adjustment records.
Resolve stocks discrepancies.

Purchasing & Supplier Control

Supervise stock movement and initiate purchase orders.
Follow-up on delivery shortages, rejects & reworks with suppliers.
Provide rolling forecast to supplier for capacity booking.
Resolve discrepancies in purchasing contracts with finance and suppliers.
Implement measures with suppliers to reduce lead-time and achieve timely delivery.
Co-ordinate drawing/specification revisions to suppliers.
Co-ordinate phase-in of new material – Risk Mitigation
Attend to new supplier approval and co-ordinate phase-in process.
Maintain supplier information in Vendor Master File.
Maintain retention of purchasing records.

Product Champion

Compute actual material cost and spare parts selling price for assigned product.
Attend to MRB disposition for assigned product
Attend to ECRN implementation for assigned product
Maintain Bill of Materials (BPM) and Item Master in MRP system for assigned product

Others

Maintain and upkeep ISO 9001:2015 system.
Prepare monthly report on ITO, OTS, and materials update.
Knowledge on Automation Intelligence system to help on Material Planning.

Who You Are:

You build partnerships and collaborative work with others to meet the target objectives set by the team. You are an active learner who uses both success and failure as learning opportunities. You take action quickly and critically in fast paced and unexpected situations. You maintain a positive attitude despite adversity.



For This Role, You Will Need:
Diploma / Degree in Purchasing, Engineering or Business is required.
Minimum 2 years of planning or purchasing experience in a manufacturing environment.

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
Solid understanding in purchasing, inventory control and MRP system.

Position Snapshot

Location: Singapore

Company: Nestle R&D Singapore – Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences Singapore Hub

Type of contract: 2 years traineeship programme


Position Summary

Over the last 5 years, the 800 employees of our Nestlé Research organization have published around 1000 scientific publications in peer reviewed journals and filed about 80 patents every year. Nestlé Research also collaborates with approximately 100 universities or research institutes around the world. Nestlé Research delivers game-changing scientific discoveries to enhance quality of life and contribute to a healthier future (learn more about Nestlé Research at www.nestle.com/randd). Nestle Research is present in Asia: with hubs in Singapore and Beijing, where our teams are working with the global Nestlé community to advance innovative science-based solutions to address major nutrition challenges in Asia-Pacific.




Our team is currently looking for an R&D trainee in Nutrition & Health. In this role you will propose, define and lead project activities related to the exploration of nutritional and health potential of ingredients and products. In collaboration with internal and external partners, your role would be to translate business needs into research approaches, transferring scientific findings to business applications. In return, we offer excellent career development and mentoring opportunities with established senior scientists and business professionals to support your career aspirations.


A day in the life of...

Develop and execute research activities in projects related to nutrition and health potential of ingredients and products.
Propose and support research projects to address key research questions of relevance for business applications.
Manage relationships with a network of internal and external partners (scientists and clinical investigators).
Provide scientific support to colleagues in business units (scientific, medical and regulatory affairs, safety, innovation and marketing teams).
Contribute towards transfer of scientific knowledge and learnings into business relevant applications.
Contribute to the development of scientific publications.
Effective dissemination of scientific outcomes to internal and external stakeholders.


What will make you successful

Master’s degree in Nutrition Science, Food Science, Biological Sciences or related field. Recent Ph.D. graduates are welcome.
Having a strong interest in research and development, coupled with prior experience in conducting nutrition and/or food science research, will be highly advantageous.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and propose innovative solutions.
Publication history in peer-reviewed journals.
Excellent written and oral presentation skills in English.


Show us your excellent communication skills and capacity to convey complex scientific topics to non-scientific audiences. Your ability to work in teams and collaborate while being autonomous and a self-starter would be key.

The Team:
Our Building Services teams at Cundall have a mission: they want to play a key role in making buildings more energy efficient, cost effective to run and, ultimately, more sustainable. To do this, we’re looking for graduates who have a desire and enthusiasm to make a difference: in our homes, our offices, our projects, our industry and our community.


Working across a variety of industry sectors, our Building Services engineers are a source of world leading expertise; producing innovative and award-winning sustainable engineering solutions throughout the lifecycle of any building project.

With 26 offices globally, we offer a pro-active and collaborative approach to skill development, professional excellence and knowledge sharing.

Our Building Services teams have accomplished amazing projects like an innovative office for Google, the largest arts centre in Scotland, and an energy efficient data centre for Facebook. As a graduate in the team, you could play a key part in our next big project.
The Role:
In this Graduate Mechanical Engineer role based in our Singapore office, you’ll join a team who specialise in the design of some of the most exciting construction projects in Asia and worldwide.

Working closely with colleagues across our multi-disciplinary practice, you’ll provide specialist consultancy input on projects across a wide range of sectors including education, healthcare, workplace, retail and critical systems (data centres).

Under the guidance of our team of experienced engineers, we’ll equip you to undertake detailed mechanical building services engineering design and analysis, define and translate clients’ needs into designs for buildings, facilities and services (ventilation, cooling and air conditioning, heating systems and more) - all with sustainability at the forefront of the design.

You’ll have the opportunity over time to assume greater levels of responsibility and autonomy as your professional skills develop and with accredited professional development programmes from CIBSE and IMechE you’ll be fully supported towards achieving chartership.
The Skills:
Accredited with, or on course to achieve a MEng degree level (or equivalent) in Mechanical or Building Services Engineering, you’re passionate about innovative and sustainable mechanical engineering for the built environment. Ideally, you’ll have furthered this interest by undertaking some form of relevant work experience or placement/internship.


You have an appreciation for the core elements of mechanical building services engineering and crucially, have a love for creative and intuitive design. Digital engineering is a big focus at Cundall, so ideally, you’ll have an understanding of Parametric Modelling Techniques (Grasshopper or Dynamo), or at least one modern programming language (e.g. Python, C#, VB). An understanding of Engineering Optimisation Techniques, the principles of structured programming and basic knowledge in the application of Machine Learning would also be desirable.


You are organised and methodical in your approach to managing your tasks and priorities, you strive to meet deadlines and have a close appreciation of the commercial factors which affect design solutions.


Collaborative in nature, you’ll be able to empathise with your clients’ needs and utilise excellent communication skills, both in writing and verbally, with internal and external stakeholders. You’re used to using your initiative to overcome challenges and have a positive, can-do attitude.


What’s in it for you?


We offer a competitive starting salary which grows as you develop, as well as many training and development opportunities to make sure you keep progressing. Aside from this, those who successfully join our graduate scheme also enjoy:




Professional career development and mentoring
Sponsorship for professional membership
Exposure to international opportunities


Job Description


Why Join Cundall?


Cundall values equality and diversity, and welcomes applications from candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

Company Overview

Clarksons is the world’s leading provider of integrated shipping and offshore services, bringing our connections and experience to an international client base. Our intelligence adds value by enabling clients to make more efficient and informed decisions. Our global reach, local knowledge and expertise is what makes us unique.

To understand more about day-to-day life at Clarksons, and what you can expect from us as an employer, visit us at www.clarksons.com .





Division

The Offshore group has vast expertise in brokerage, serves the shipping and offshore industry worldwide by providing shipbrokering services within chartering, sale and purchase and contracting of ships and offshore units. We maintain a strong relationship and extensive communication with the majority of the world’s leading shipowners and oil companies which represents a considerable source of business opportunities.





Role Summary

The main purpose of a Ship Broker is to act as a specialist intermediary/ negotiator between shipowners and charterers to arrange ocean transport of goods and commodities by sea, the employment of a vessel or to buy/ sell ships on behalf of a client. A career in Ship Broking is exciting, interesting, challenging and highly competitive, not to mention rewarding.

We have a great opportunity for a talented Trainee Broker to join our Offshore team in our Singapore office. You will work alongside our experienced Brokers to help strengthen relationships with existing clients for sales and help develop new business.

Ideally, you will have some broking experience and will be keen to develop your experience. You must also be driven and self-motivated and be a strong relationship builder.

Fresh university graduates are also welcome to apply for this position.





What you will be doing

Support the day-to-day activities of the Senior Brokers on the Offshore desk
Maintain databases and market information and reports for clients
Maintain accurate records and documentation
Develop knowledge and expertise relevant to the shipping market, in particular Offshore broking
Establish and maintain effective relationships internally and externally
Prepare reports and analysis for clients
Help to identify ways to drive and develop new business and identify and introduce new clients
Be aware of the positions and desired strategic directions for each shipyard
Help to manage internal data flow of key market information
Attend meetings and events with clients where required
Help to conduct post fixture support in a prompt and efficient manner
Continue to build knowledge in the Offshore arena and market space
Help perform market analysis and provide insight and trade ideas to clients
Assist with producing internal and external reporting
Maintain a database of sales activity





What we are looking for

Key Attributes

A good university degree majoring in Maritime Studies or a related discipline
Previous experience or exposure within broking is desirable but is not mandatory
Knowledge of the Offshore market will be an advantage
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)
Fluency in Mandarin and English is essential
Personable and engaging
Assertive and outgoing personality
Able to build strong working relationships with clients
Good commercial judgement with good negotiation skills
Driven, self-motivated and client focused
Strong numeracy skills and excellent presentation skills
Confident and able to work well under pressure
Strong attention to detail and focus on accuracy
Team player with a flexible approach
Strong MS office skills in Excel, PowerPoint, Word





Special Job Requirements

Travel as required.





How to Apply

If you would like to apply for this position, please send your resume and cover letter to HR.Singapore@clarksons.com .

Company Profile

Our Company provide one stop solution on accounting, tax and corporate secretarial matters. We also provide consultancy services on IT and accounting software solutions.

Job Description

We are seeking dynamic and detail-oriented university students, recent graduates, or interns to join our team as Process Mapping Assistant. In this role, you will work closely with our project managers and team members to accurately document and visualize organizational processes and workflows using PowerPoint or related software. Your primary responsibility will be to create clear and concise process maps, flowcharts, and diagrams that illustrate the sequence of activities, decision points, and interactions within various business functions.

Requirements:

Currently enrolled in a university program, recent graduate, or pursuing an internship in a related field such as Business Administration, Management, Industrial Engineering, or Information Systems.

Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint or similar software for creating visual representations of processes.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to break down complex processes into manageable components.

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey technical information in a clear and concise manner.

Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality in process documentation.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Eagerness to learn and adapt to new tools and technologies related to process mapping.

Prior experience or coursework in process improvement, business analysis, or project management is a plus.

Availability to work part-time or full-time hours on temporary or contract basis, depending on internship or student status.

Job Title: Associate Analyst Business Development, Launch Graduate Program 2024 - Singapore
Job Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Title and Summary
Associate Analyst Business Development, Launch Graduate Program 2024 - Singapore
Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

The Mastercard Launch program is aimed at early career talent, to help you develop skills and gain cross-functional work experience. Over a period of 18 months, Launch participants will be assigned to a business unit, learn and develop skills, and gain valuable on the job experience. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets and rotate for a duration of 2 x 9 months each for a total of 18 months.

Role Description and Major Responsibilities:

Work on a business development project to solve a critical business pain-point or identify a new business opportunity in the applicable location
Work closely with the Front-Line Sales Non-FIs to identify new solutions and opportunities for growth
Execute business development activities, including preparation and analysis of data insights to identify opportunities and to inform business strategies
Produce presentation materials for external customer engagements, as well as management updates for senior executives
Gather rich insights for each market segment and customers and map them with Mastercard’s internal data to identify clear opportunities across core products, emerging products, e-commerce and digital partnerships
Work with leaders on comprehensive plans and research that is aligned with the country strategy
Assist in curating story telling sales decks (from the customer lens) to demonstrate how Mastercard solutions can solve customer pain points
Participate with Team Management for customer sales calls to highlight Mastercard differentiators and win new business, as required
Supports senior colleagues on ongoing initiatives and strategic projects

All about you:

Highly motivated, intellectually curious, analytical, and a strong team player.
Extremely organised and able to independently manage multiple projects and initiatives with varying scope concurrently.
Excellent relationship building skills; able to foster and maintain strong, positive working internal and external relationships across multiple business functions and markets.
Highly customer focused with a demonstrated ability to understand and respond to customer needs.
Outstanding communication and presentation skills, able to clearly tailor the message to the audience and communicate complex products and processes.
Fresh university graduate with a Bachelor's degree, graduating between July 2023 and July 2024.
Fluency in English is mandatory, additional Asian languages would be a plus.
Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Profil du candidat

TotalEnergies Trading Graduate Program - 2024

Are you looking to grow your career in the vibrant world of energy trading (Oil, Gas and Power)?


Are you looking to discover a fulfilling and dynamic place to work as soon as you graduate?

If yes, we would love to see your profile as we are now looking for multifaceted talents who are passionate about the energy-trading world to join our 2-year program.


Don’t wait any longer, apply and join the TotalEnergies Trading Graduate Program in Singapore!


Who do we look for?

You hold a relevant Master’s Degree or equivalent from 2023 or 2024 such as in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Energy
You have some international experience, for example you studied a semester abroad, you worked as an intern or volunteered in another country than the one you are originally from
Standing together is one of our key values so it is essential that you demonstrate a good team spirit
You are a forward-thinking and performance driven person with excellent interpersonal skills showing assertiveness, confidence and resilience and you have the ability to operate autonomously
Innovation being at the heart of our DNA we hope to welcome people with an entrepreneurial and agile mind-set with excellent communication skills
Most importantly, you have a strong interest for commodity trading and you are eager to widen your knowledge during this 2-year journey.
You thrive in changing environments and you can deal with uncertainty or fast evolving situations
You are fluent in English and globally mobile.


Do you think you meet these requirements? If yes, don’t wait any longer and apply!





Activités

How do you apply?

Upload your CV and feel free to share a short motivation statement
Click on the link below and complete the three online assessments:
https://afir.st/WJ4YQefGvu5xqH8w
These tests assess your key behaviours, your motivations as well as your cognitive abilities. Each test can be completed independently (average completion time per test: 12 min). We appreciate that you may not have the time to complete these tests on the day of your application and this is why you will be able to complete them within up to five days from your application date. However, please kindly take note that the completion of the online assessments is compulsory for a valid application and that no reminder will be sent to you. It is possible to take the assessment on all supports (Mobile, IPad, PC) and in 12 languages so be mindful to select your mother tongue to feel at ease.


As we want to provide you with an enriching experience, you will receive a synthesis of your assessment as soon as you have completed it!

And what’s next?




Applications will remain open until end of April 2024. Should you be selected for Round 1, you will then be notified in May 2024.
The interview process will involve up to 4 rounds and it will be a mix of remote and onsite sessions (HR online interview, sessions with our Managers and Traders including a case study and an assessment with our senior leaders). More details will be provided in due course!
Successful applicants will join the program on October, 1st 2024.


At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.



Contexte et environnement
Step into a thrilling, fast-paced trading environment where every moment counts.




Become one of the drivers of energy transition with TotalEnergies Trading Graduate Program.


TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.

TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S), an international trading company, puts its expertise to use in the global energy markets. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies T&S is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. Our maritime transport expertise also helps to reduce the carbon footprint of sea transportation and we recently announced the time chartering of new vessels equipped with LNG propulsion.

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Oil, Gas & Power trading activities represent around 1200 positions worldwide.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.
Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.
Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.
We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

What do we offer?

By joining our Trading Graduate Program you can shape your future; don’t wait any longer and start to build your career with us.

Over two exciting years, you will rotate across four departments, where you will quickly understand how we operate as a company and gain a wide-ranging appreciation of our key functions preparing you to grow your career within the Trading business units.
The rotations will take place in key trading support functions: Middle Office, Trading Operations and Market Analysis.
The fourth rotation will be defined based on individual capabilities as well as business needs. It may include Credit Analysis, Quantitative Analysis, Shipping, Digital Lab etc…
As part of the program, subject to performance, one of the rotations will be completed in a different country to where you started the program (Geneva or Houston) where you will develop your intercultural communication skills!

The four rotations will consist of a blend of T&S (crude oil, oil products including biofuels) and TGP (mainly gas, LNG and power) assignments. This is undeniably a unique opportunity to experience an enriching multi-energies journey!
Our program will be engaging and intense. In addition to usual Business activities, we are offering a comprehensive training program including:


a purpose-built integration week
on-the-job as well as online trainings and a dedicated training path
regular mentoring sessions with our Senior Talent Developers

We invite you to visit our Graduate Program section and to “Meet” some of our Graduates, watch our videos:
Discover more about TotalEnergies Trading Graduate Program

About the Role

Our award-winning, industry-leading graduate program is looking for exceptional individuals who will challenge us, as we will challenge them. You will work on real business problems, gain exposure through rotations in the Commercial function, engage in meaningful interactions with our leaders and make real contributions to the business to build a better world.

Our fast paced 24-month Commercial program will accelerate your career by giving you access to opportunities across commodities and regions. The structured program balances between building your technical and professional capabilities where you learn on-the-job and are supported by formal trainings to complement your experience. As part of the program, you will also undertake a Global Business Case team challenge that will challenge you as you explore solutions for the business.




What we are looking for:

We are looking for exceptional graduates who are focused, resourceful and wants to work in a performance driven culture. We believe that our graduates are the next generation, global custodians of our Assets. Our leaders are ready and able to develop the leadership and technical skills of Graduates into extraordinary careers that create lasting impact.

To be eligible for the Commercial program in Singapore, you must have graduated in 2022 or 2023 or be eligible for graduation by the end of 2024 with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent in one of the following disciplines (but not limited to):

Business, Economics, Finance and Management
Engineering and Mathematics
Computer Science and Data Analytics
Marine and Supply Chain Operations
Humanities and Sciences




Applications will close on March 15, 2024.


About Our Process


At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.


Supporting a Diverse Workforce

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

Working hours: 10am to 6pm (Monday to Friday)





We are looking for highly motivated individuals who aspire to grow and lead in management roles.

Job Title: Associate - Business Consulting (Financial Services), Business Transformation (Fresh Graduate)
Job Description:
The Opportunity

In today’s volatile and unpredictable world, making the right decisions is key to successful and sustained business performance – more so than it has been ever before. As a Business Transformation consultant, you’ll use your analytical ability to translate the corporate strategy of leading organizations into meaningful change.


Business Transformation consultants at EY are strategic thinkers, as well as the engine room of our business, working on the front lines globally with our clients, colleagues and third-parties to transform businesses. They work across different segments within Financial Services, cross-pollinating with the best of customer, strategy, operations, digital and technology to design, build and run the businesses of tomorrow. They traverse the entire spectrum from strategy and innovation, through to experience transformation and digitization of operations. No two days are the same.

They embrace an outcome oriented culture, living EY’s core values, and widely collaborate with several other internal teams to consistently deliver value-added outcomes for our clients.


Your Key Responsibilities

The Business Transformation team focuses on strategy, future operating models, experience design, platforms, innovation and execution. The sheer nature of wide scope of work will require you to collaborate across teams to bring the best of EY to solve the client’s problem statements
Support senior team in developing new content for our clients which can include market research/sizing, as well as creating scalable digital solutions that solve teething client issues
Prepare timely, quality output and deliverables per client’s needs
Participate in business development activities and create client pitches and proposals
Form part of our client project delivery teams where you will manage deliverables, analyze data, prepare presentations and design solutions


Skills and Attributes for Success

You should be passionate about working with multiple parts of the businesses across different Financial Services domains, solutioning and delivering complex digital solutions
You find yourself always wanting to solve problems, innovate and shape the industry, wanting to differentiate
You should be able to understand and appreciate both sides of a coin, the business aspect and the technology aspect to enable business aspirations
You always see yourself as someone who is looking for opportunities to turn day to day business challenges into automated, frictionless working solutions aimed at providing the best client experience
You have an analytical mindset and a structured problem-solving approach
You enjoy communicating with people from various backgrounds and skillsets across an organization, and have always been great at communicating ideas across various channels and mediums


To Qualify for the role, you must have

An attitude to learn, approach problems head on, to be willing to roll your sleeves up to find solutions
Structured problem solving, quantitative analysis, and storylining skills
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Ability to work in collaborative and client-facing environments
Strong business analysis experience


Ideally, you should also have

A design thinking mindset including user research, functional requirements definition, business process analysis, business modelling, and workshop design and facilitation
Working knowledge of the full lifecycle of operating model definition, roadmap creation and its execution
Experience of working with or as part of scrum teams
Detailed knowledge of creating user stories/requirements definition/acceptance criteria using agile tools and techniques
Some prototyping / wireframing knowledge and experience
Experience of developing and documenting user stories and epics
Knowledge of tools like Figma, Adobe XD


What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive compensation package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and will be recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:

Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues and mentors
Opportunities to develop new skills and shape your career the way you want to
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that is right for you
A diverse and inclusive culture. You will be embraced for who you are and will be empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs

KPMG in Singapore is part of a global organization of independent professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services.
